name: 系統演化學特論
description: This is a topical course, focusing on understanding the basic concepts, principles and skills of systematics, how to design a feasible study plan, set up experiments and obtain data, and how to analyze data. It will also include lectures on how current methodologies and techniques are applied to solve systematic problems.
goals: The major objectives of this course are to provide basic background in systematics and to deliver the most updated knowledge, skills and applications of genomics to systematic problems.
syllabus:
​

Week 1:   Introduction to systematics

Week 2:   Nomenclature

Week 3:   Species concepts

Week 4:   Application of species concepts

Week 5:   Speciation

Week 6:   Approaches in speciation study

Week 7:   Phenetics: cluster analyses and PCA

Week 8:   Phenetics: morphometrics

Week 9:  Mid-term report

Week 10:  Cladistics: general backgroud

Week 11:  Cladistics: current methodologies

Week 12:  Cladistics: softwares for analyses

Week 13:  Case studies

Week 14:  strategies in systematics

Week 15:  Phylogenetic systematics

Week 16:  Phylogeography

Week 17:  Additional applications

Week 18:  Final report
